title: How to learn content writing - Quora

response.answer_text: If you’re just starting off, a lot of content specialists will start off their advice with “practice writing” or an equivalent statement. As someone who’s seen hundreds of content sites generate enough monthly net profit so an entire family doesn’t have to work and live a comfortable lifestyle, I can tell you some of the skills you need to create great content. First off, the advice to practice your craft isn’t wrong. But I’d argue quality over quantity rings especially true in this instance. Highly valuable content achieves two things: meets a specified business goal and generates traffic to the content. Start with “Why”? For the first goal, ask yourself what is the purpose of your content. Some common goals include: Become a go-to article about a specific topic in my nicheEducate readers about what’s trendingProvide an in-depth analysis on a phenomenon like a high-performing product/serviceKeeping this goal in mind gives you direction when writing the content. Knowing the goal helps you answer who are you writing this for, what’s the problem you’re addressing, and what is the solution you’re offering. I like to use the “Jobs to be done” approach when thinking about my content. Professor Theodore Levitt from Harvard Business School once said “People don’t want to buy a quarter-inch drill, they want a quarter-inch hole!” People want to know how your services or product will help them. If your service is writing about products in a niche, the value you provide is saving people time with thorough research and sound evidence behind why you recommend certain products. Demonstrating your expertise really gives readers confidence in what you’re writing about and gives them peace of mind when making a choice between products. All eyes on me Content isn’t useful if no-one is reading it, no matter how well-written it is. Optimizing your content so it’s SEO-friendly helps your articles appear in front of more viewers when they look for answers on search engines. Learn what keywords are and how to research them. Keywords are the phrases people punch into Google, like “calories in ice cream”. Structure your content around these keywords. You can analyze the intent behind them. Take the “calories in ice cream” example—someone could be searching for the actual calories amount because they’re on a diet and want to make sure they’re within their calorific budget. Pivot on the intent and create content to help answer what people are looking for. Other benefits of creating great content for SEO purposes are: Increases traffic to the siteGet backlinks from sites with high-authorityGenerate leadsOptimize your site for readability and make sure it’s a seamless experience transitioning from page to page. Visitors can get turned off and leave very quickly if your site loads very slowly or widgets are misaligned. Start with a KISS Kiss stands for “Keep It Simple Stupid”. I’m not a huge fan of the acronym but it’s easy to remember when you write your content. In school we learn how to insert adverbs and flowery descriptions to beautify our writing. That doesn’t work when you’re trying to great awesome content that brings people back over and over. The average reading level in the US is the 8th grade (13–14 year olds). Keep vocabulary limited and your sentences easy to read. Shorter sentences and small paragraphs are effective. Even if your target audience can read very complicated things for their job, no one wants to. Attention is at a premium nowadays and people often want quick and easy solutions. I’ve described some of the core aspects of creating great content. You can start writing about things you’re interested in your own blog. After you build up enough content, this serves as a portfolio to show to people looking for help with writing. Apply for freelancing gigs as a side income stream. If your blog gets enough traffic, you can even monetize it so it earns you a bit of passive income each month. Many entrepreneurs build online businesses that generate enough monthly net profit that replaces their main job. I’ve even seen content sites sell for $100,00 upwards, with our largest sale being $1,470,000. Learning how to create really good content is a fantastic skill that will be useful for a while. Don’t worry about your whether your current content is good enough right now. Focus on improving with each article you write. If you earn money from side income, I’d also suggest reinvesting it back into yourself to level up your skills and you can charge more. Attend courses by experienced writers. Read books to learn some great copywriting and writing principles. Keep striving to be a bit better than you were yesterday. Think of the process as making 1 degree changes. Up close, your progress seems insignificant. But over time, you’ll see your ability veer so far away from where you originally started. You’ll barely be able to recognize yourself from when you first started when you become an amazing content writer.

Content writing is different from what we think as hobby writing. If one is writing purely for fun or in a personal blog (where you just express your thoughts and do not intend to fetch traffic), then learning content writing is not a priority. Being grammatically correct and visually presentable will serve our purpose. However, if we are planning to take up content writing professionally then it is important to understand how it functions and how our content can be beneficial to the organization. To be a professional content writer (be it freelancing or any other organization) it is a mandate to understand how SEO works. It is important to understand why clients and organizations are willing to hire a content writer. Below are some of the key points that are much needed to be a professional content writer: When we take up to learn content writing, it gives us a clear understanding and knowledge of how organic search works. It is a key factor that we need to understand.It is vital for us to understand how search engines work and how we should align our content so that our content is not blocked by search engines.It is imperative to understand how keywords work and various tools to analyse the usage of keywords in our content. Unnecessary usage of keywords can result in a negative result.The concept of backlinks and how to use it correctly is needed. Relevant usage of backlinks can improve the ranking of website.We get to learn about various tools that can enhance our content, both visually and technically. It is highly recommended that we understand the correct handling of these tools.It is through a well structured content, we can get traffic to our websites.If we are planning to monetize content writing, it is very important to understand the technicalities of the same.
